title: The X Factor: Celebrity episode 1 review - a mashup of Love Island, Strictly, Baywatch and 'that' Princess Diana interview
text:
After 15 years of The X Factor - of making humble nobodies into stars and millions for his Syco label in the process - Simon Cowell got bored. (Or perhaps, he got wind of the show’s viewing figures, which have been in decline year on year since since the show’s zenith in 2010, when One Direction came third before going onto sell 50 million records worldwide.)

“And so it’s time to try something different,” asserted Cowell in the first hour and a half episode of the show’s freshly revamped format, The X Factor: Celebrity (ITV), in which pedestrians are swapped for C-list celebs from across the globe. “My credibility is at stake. If it doesn’t work I look like a total idiot,” he said. At first...
description: After 15 years of The X Factor - of making humble nobodies into stars and millions for his Syco label in the process - Simon Cowell got bored.
